deck: Mauricio Vargas is a storyboard artist who has worked on several commercials for companies such as Coca-Cola, Pepsi, Snickers, Milky Way, and Cricket, for the Latin American and American markets. He also has worked for advertising directors in Europe, Canada, Argentina, Uruguay, Mexico, and the United States.
name: Mauricio Vargas

deck: Rodrigo Tobias Eyzaguirre is the colorist of Destiny’s Fate.
name: Rodrigo Tobias

description:
Paul McCaffrey has recently illustrated Lavie Tidhar's controversial "children's" picture book Going To The Moon, published by The House of Murky Depths. He also illustrated the wraparound cover for Dead Girls #3 with an unusual inside-cover "wraparound".

He has also been artist on DC's 52 Men Of War.
name: Paul McCaffrey

description:
Abouet was born in Abidjan, in 1979. She moved to France with her family when she was little.

Later, she became a legal assistant, and on the side, tried to write books for children. She quit doing both (the childrens books, because all the publishers she was in contact with, had too strict line about the books that "should" be made for kids). Then she started to write Aya. She`s been doing that ever since.
name: Marguerite Abouet

aliases:
Robert Lawrence Stine
Jovial Bob Stine
Bob Stine
deck: Novelist and short story writer. Most famous for writing a series of children books and horror fiction such as "Fear Street", "Goosebumps", and "Mostly Ghostly".
description:
Robert Lawrence Stine, better known as R. L. Stine, is an American novelist and short story writer of children books and horror fiction, and other genre.

About his job he says "My job is to give kids the CREEPS!"

Stine is most famous for a series of books of children's horror fiction such as "Fear Street", "Goosebumps", "Mostly Ghostly", "Rotten School" and "The Nightmare Room", as well as his trilogy "Space Cadets".

Stine is married to fellow editor and writer Jane Waldhorn. They have written many novels and short stories together, then mostly credited under the pseudonyms Jovial Bob Stine & June Stine and Bob & Jane Stine respectively. The letter can be found in many comic adaptions of their short stories.
name: R. L. Stine

deck: A Swedish artist and graduate of The Kubert School.
name: Henrik Jonsson

deck: François Maingoval is a Belgian comic book writer.
description: François Maingoval was born on May 5, 1975, in Belgium. He grew up in an appartment formerly rented by Peyo, creator of The Smurfs, and the master's old workshop was his first bedroom. He wrote his first cript at 14 and had two gags published in Le Journal De Tintin when he was 16. He continued to write for various comic book magazines while pursuing engineering studies in Louvain. In 1998 he had a chance online meeting with Vincent Dutreuil, who was looking for a writer and that led to the creation of Les Spectres du Caire, his first album, in the Ada Enigma series. He then worked on several new series, such as Barbara Wolf, with Bruno Marivain or L’Empreinte de Satan with Ed-Nane, as well as several one-shots, such as Lovely Trouble and Les Allumeuses. In 2005, Maingoval joins Jacques Martin's team and starts scripting the Les Aventures D'Alix series based on the master's synopsises. He initiated the short-lived spinoff Alix Raconte, a series of fictionalized biography novels based on important figures of the Ancient World such as Alexander The Great, Nero and Cleopatra. In addition to his comic book work, François Maingoval coaches business executives.
name: François Maingoval

deck: Contributor to Aardvark underground mag (credited as Par Holman).
name: Parley Holman

deck:
Contributor to Aardvark underground mag.
Brother of Parley Holman.
name: Robert Holman

deck: Cédric Hervan is a Belgian comic book illustrator.
description: Cédric Hervan was born Cédric Van Heirweghe in Belgium on June 7, 1981. His favorite comic book creators include André Juillard, E.P. Jacobs, Jacques Martin, Frank Le Gall and Philippe Berthet, and he follows specialized classes in Waterloo under Jean-François Di Giorgio's tutelage in addition to his regular education. He meets Jacques Martin at 18, in 1999, who charges him with the creation of an album in the Les Voyages d’Alix series. Satisfied with his work, Martin commissions another volume and pairs him with Christophe Simon on an album of the flagship Les Aventures D'Alix series. Hervan was at one point meant to illustrate the fourth album of Martin's Orion series, called Roi des Rois ("King of Kings"), but the series was eventually taken over by Marc Jailloux in 2011 with a new story after he left Martin and launched his own series, Le Dernier des Schoenfeld, with writers Agnès Barrat-Bartoll and Jean-Claude Bartoll, who he met on Internet.
name: Cédric Hervan

deck: Christophe Simon is a Belgian comic book illustrator.
description: Christophe Simon was born in Belgium on August 16, 1974. After studying drawing at the Chatelet academy under the tutelage of Vittorio Léonardo and a year of history, art and archeology, he meets Jacques Martin at 19, in 1993 and starts collaborating with the master on some of his major series, Alix, Lefranc and Orion.
name: Christophe Simon

deck: Patrick Weber is a Belgian writer and reporter.
description: Patrick Weber was born in Belgium on March 10, 1966. He starts out as a reporter and by 17, already has articles published in a number of magazines and newspapers. After having studied art history and archeology in university, he works in television for two years before returning to newspapers and starting to write historical books, novels and comic books, notably within Jacques Martin's empire of franchises. Since 2011, he has added radio anchor to his resume. He is married and lives between Brussels, Paris and Rome.
name: Patrick Weber

issues.name: Steamy & Heart Thumping Emotions of a Traveller
The Girl Who Fell From the Sky

deck: Fernand Van Vosselen, aka Ferry, is a Belgian comic book writer and illustrator.
description: Fernand Van Vosselen was born in Belgium on April 23, 1944. In 1970 he works at Belgian newspaper Le Soir, before shortly joining the Belgian edition of Pilote in 1973 and then Le Journal De Tintin in 1974, where he draws a number of short strips based on incredible true stories, written by Yves Duval. The strips were collected by Le Lombard in 1984, in a volume entitled Les Grandes Catastrophes. In 1977, he creates Russian aristocrat Ian Kalédine with writer Jean-Luc Vernal. Ten adventures featuring the character are published by Le Lombard between 1983 and 1992. In 1993, Ferry starts working on the Chroniques de Panchrysia, which he writes himself for the first issue, before being joined by Pombal.
name: Fernand Van Vosselen

deck: Marco Venanzi is a Belgian comic book writer and illustrator.
description: Marco Venanzi was born in Italy on December 14th, 1963. In 1986, after studying in Liège, he draws his first historical strips in Le Journal de Tintin and Tintin Reporter based on scripts by Michel Dusart, who also writes his first album, Froidure, in 1990. The next year he takes over from André Juillard on Masquerouge. In 2003 he launches the Hidalgos series with Michel Pierret and wins an award at the Angoulême festival for another work. Two years later he draws a comic book biography of soccer legend Zinedine Zidane and in 2008 joins the Jacques Martin empire by working on an album in the Les Voyages De Jhen series and later the flagship Les Aventures D'Alix series.
name: Marco Venanzi

deck: Michel Lafon is a French author.
description: Michel Lafon was born on April 17, 1952. He has written numerous essays on Argentine literature as well as a book about co-writing, Nous Est Un Autre ("We Are Another"), itself co-written with Benoît Peeters. He has served as editor on a number of biographies and wrote the introduction to Jean-Pierre Mourey's comic book adaptation of The Invention of Morel, published by Casterman, who offer him the chance to write an an album of Les Aventures D'Alix, his favorite comic book as a child.
name: Michel Lafon

deck: Diego Yapur is a Argentine Comic Book Artist and Illustrator
name: Diego Yapur

deck: Robert M. Heske is an award-winning, published comic creator and screenwriter
name: Robert Heske
